intro: Alibertia iquitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian quina, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, slightly bitter leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves contain compounds such as quinine, which have been historically used for their medicinal properties. The botanical features of Alibertia iquitensis make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
